unnormalised: ## Flash Sales: Grab 'em Before They're Gone, Yaar!
normalised: ## Flash Sales: Grab them Before They're Gone, Yaar!

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Ever felt that heart-stopping moment when you see something you absolutely LOVE, only to realize the price tag is a tad...optimistic? Well, that's where flash sales swoop in like a Bollywood hero, ready to save the day (and your wallet!).
normalised: Hey everyone! Ever felt that heart-stopping moment when you see something you absolutely LOVE, only to realize the price tag is a tad...optimistic? Well, that's where flash sales swoop in like a Bollywood hero, ready to save the day (and your wallet!).

unnormalised: Think of flash sales as those crazy-delicious biryani offers at your local Karim's during Eid. Suddenly, a plate that usually costs Rs. 300 is going for Rs. 200, but only for, like, 2 hours! That's the essence, folks! Short-term, deeply discounted offers that create a sense of urgency.
normalised: Think of flash sales as those crazy-delicious biryani offers at your local Karim's during Eid. Suddenly, a plate that usually costs rupees three hundred is going for rupees two hundred, but only for, like, two hours! That's the essence, folks! Short-term, deeply discounted offers that create a sense of urgency.

unnormalised: For us in India, especially during festive seasons like Diwali or Onam, flash sales are practically a national sport. Websites like Myntra, Amazon, and even smaller e-commerce platforms jump into the fray, offering incredible deals on everything from sarees to smartphones. Remember that jaw-dropping sale on Lehengas during Navratri last year? I almost emptied my bank account!

unnormalised: But here's the thing: flash sales are a double-edged sword. They're fantastic for snagging that perfect Diwali gift for your Chacha Ji or upgrading your phone without breaking the bank. But, they also create that FOMO (Fear Of Missing Out) that can lead to impulse purchases.
normalised: But here's the thing: flash sales are a double-edged sword. They're fantastic for snagging that perfect Diwali gift for your Chacha Ji or upgrading your phone without breaking the bank. But, they also create that F O M O (Fear Of Missing Out) that can lead to impulse purchases.

unnormalised: So, how do you navigate this exciting, sometimes overwhelming, world of flash sales? Simple! Have a clear budget, make a list of what you actually need (not just want!), and set reminders. Don't get swept away by the hype!
normalised: So, how do you navigate this exciting, sometimes overwhelming, world of flash sales? Simple! Have a clear budget, make a list of what you actually need (not just want!), and set reminders. Don't get swept away by the hype!

unnormalised: Think of it like navigating the chaotic streets of Chandni Chowk during peak hours. You need a plan, a clear destination, and a bit of patience!
normalised: Think of it like navigating the chaotic streets of Chandni Chowk during peak hours. You need a plan, a clear destination, and a bit of patience!

unnormalised: This Onam, keep an eye out for flash sales on traditional Kerala sarees. You might just find that perfect kasavu saree you've been dreaming of at a price you can actually afford! Happy shopping, everyone! Remember to shop responsibly. Also, remember that delivery might take more time than usual due to high demand, especially if you're ordering from a place like Kottayam which is, like, 2500 km away from Delhi. So, plan accordingly!
